message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a history of a recent trip to Nigeria and works on a fishing trawler, which puts him at risk of cutaneous larva migrans. The linear, serpiginous rash also supports this diagnosis. Contact dermatitis would not present in this pattern nor would it be related to his recent travel. Tinea would present with scaling lesions and not linear, serpiginous lesions. Superficial thrombophlebitis would cause a painful, tender, and warm cord-like structure along the affected vein.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The picture shows a winding, serpiginous rash, which is highly suggestive of Cutaneous larva migrans, a condition caused by hookworm larvae. The patient's recent travel to Nigeria and work on a fishing trawler also increases the likelihood of exposure to hookworm larvae. Contact dermatitis would not present with this type of rash, and tinea would not have the winding, serpiginous appearance. Superficial thrombophlebitis would present with a palpable, tender cord along the affected vein.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a history of recent travel to a tropical country and works on a fishing trawler. The rash is itchy and appears to have a serpiginous pattern, which is characteristic of cutaneous larva migrans. Contact dermatitis would be more localized, Tinea would not have the serpiginous pattern, and superficial thrombophlebitis usually causes pain and tenderness along the affected vein.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the fact that the patient works on a fishing trawler suggest that he may have been infected with cutaneous larva migrans, a type of skin infection caused by hookworms. The picture of the rash also supports this diagnosis. Contact dermatitis would likely affect more than just the ankle and calf, and tinea would present differently. Superficial thrombophlebitis would present with redness and tenderness over a superficial vein.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s recent travel history and working on a fishing trawler suggest a possible exposure to parasites. The picture of the rash shows a classic presentation of cutaneous larva migrans, which is caused by hookworm larvae penetrating the skin. None of the other options fit the patient’s history or presentation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The rash is a serpiginous track, which suggests Cutaneous larva migrans from hookworm infestation. The patient’s recent trip to Nigeria increases the likelihood of parasitic infection. Contact dermatitis is a localized rash, Tinea presents as scaly, ring-shaped patch, and Superficial thrombophlebitis presents as a tender, indurated cord.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a rash that began on the ankle and progressed up the calf, along with the patient's recent travel to Nigeria and occupation on a fishing trawler, suggest cutaneous larva migrans caused by hookworm infection. Contact dermatitis would likely involve exposure to an irritant or allergen, Tinea would likely have a different appearance, and superficial thrombophlebitis would not cause a rash.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The picture shows a classic example of cutaneous larva migrans which is often caused by walking barefoot on contaminated soil. The patient’s recent trip to Nigeria and occupation on a fishing trawler also put him at risk for exposure to soil parasites. Contact dermatitis often presents as a non-linear rash with more intense itching and erythema, and tinea does not typically progress in a linear pattern. Superficial thrombophlebitis would present with a tender, red, and warm vein overlying the involved area.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s travel history and occupation suggest a possible exposure to hookworm larvae, the causative agent of cutaneous larva migrans. The characteristic linear and serpiginous tracks on the rash also support this diagnosis. Contact dermatitis, tinea, and superficial thrombophlebitis would not present with this pattern of rash.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s recent travel to Nigeria and work on a fishing trawler suggest exposure to parasites that cause cutaneous larva migrans, which presents with a rash that starts on the foot and progresses up the leg. The rash is also itchy and mildly painful, which supports this diagnosis. Contact dermatitis would not progress in this way, and tinea would have a different appearance. Superficial thrombophlebitis does not typically cause a rash.
